00057 static const struct vm_operations_struct ll_file_vm_ops;
00058 
00059 void policy_from_vma(union ldlm_policy_data *policy, struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00060                      unsigned long addr, size_t count)
00061 {
00062         policy->l_extent.start = ((addr - vma->vm_start) & PAGE_MASK) +
00063                                  (vma->vm_pgoff << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00064         policy->l_extent.end = (policy->l_extent.start + count - 1) |
00065                                ~PAGE_MASK;
00066 }
00067 
00068 struct vm_area_struct *our_vma(struct mm_struct *mm, unsigned long addr,
00069                                size_t count)
00070 {
00071         struct vm_area_struct *vma, *ret = NULL;
00072         ENTRY;
00073 
00074         /* mmap_sem must have been held by caller. */
00075         LASSERT(!down_write_trylock(&mm->mmap_sem));
00076 
00077         for(vma = find_vma(mm, addr);
00078             vma != NULL && vma->vm_start < (addr + count); vma = vma->vm_next) {
00079                 if (vma->vm_ops && vma->vm_ops == &ll_file_vm_ops &&
00080                     vma->vm_flags & VM_SHARED) {
00081                         ret = vma;
00082                         break;
00083                 }
00084         }
00085         RETURN(ret);
00086 }
00087 
00100 static struct cl_io *
00101 ll_fault_io_init(struct vm_area_struct *vma, struct lu_env **env_ret,
00102                  struct cl_env_nest *nest, pgoff_t index,
00103                  unsigned long *ra_flags)
00104 {
00105         struct file            *file = vma->vm_file;
00106         struct inode           *inode = file->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
00107         struct cl_io           *io;
00108         struct cl_fault_io     *fio;
00109         struct lu_env          *env;
00110         int                     rc;
00111         ENTRY;
00112 
00113         *env_ret = NULL;
00114         if (ll_file_nolock(file))
00115                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EOPNOTSUPP));
00116 
00117         /*
00118          * page fault can be called when lustre IO is
00119          * already active for the current thread, e.g., when doing read/write
00120          * against user level buffer mapped from Lustre buffer. To avoid
00121          * stomping on existing context, optionally force an allocation of a new
00122          * one.
00123          */
00124         env = cl_env_nested_get(nest);
00125         if (IS_ERR(env))
00126                  RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EINVAL));
00127 
00128         *env_ret = env;
00129 
00130 restart:
00131         io = vvp_env_thread_io(env);
00132         io->ci_obj = ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob;
00133         LASSERT(io->ci_obj != NULL);
00134 
00135         fio = &io->u.ci_fault;
00136         fio->ft_index      = index;
00137         fio->ft_executable = vma->vm_flags&VM_EXEC;
00138 
00139         /*
00140          * disable VM_SEQ_READ and use VM_RAND_READ to make sure that
00141          * the kernel will not read other pages not covered by ldlm in
00142          * filemap_nopage. we do our readahead in ll_readpage.
00143          */
00144         if (ra_flags != NULL)
00145                 *ra_flags = vma->vm_flags & (VM_RAND_READ|VM_SEQ_READ);
00146         vma->vm_flags &= ~VM_SEQ_READ;
00147         vma->vm_flags |= VM_RAND_READ;
00148 
00149         CDEBUG(D_MMAP, "vm_flags: %lx (%lu %d)\n", vma->vm_flags,
00150                fio->ft_index, fio->ft_executable);
00151 
00152         rc = cl_io_init(env, io, CIT_FAULT, io->ci_obj);
00153         if (rc == 0) {
00154                 struct vvp_io *vio = vvp_env_io(env);
00155                 struct ll_file_data *fd = LUSTRE_FPRIVATE(file);
00156 
00157                 LASSERT(vio->vui_cl.cis_io == io);
00158 
00159                 /* mmap lock must be MANDATORY it has to cache
00160                  * pages. */
00161                 io->ci_lockreq = CILR_MANDATORY;
00162                 vio->vui_fd = fd;
00163         } else {
00164                 LASSERT(rc < 0);
00165                 cl_io_fini(env, io);
00166                 if (io->ci_need_restart)
00167                         goto restart;
00168 
00169                 cl_env_nested_put(nest, env);
00170                 io = ERR_PTR(rc);
00171         }
00172 
00173         RETURN(io);
00174 }
00175 
00176 /* Sharing code of page_mkwrite method for rhel5 and rhel6 */
00177 static int ll_page_mkwrite0(struct vm_area_struct *vma, struct page *vmpage,
00178                             bool *retry)
00179 {
00180         struct lu_env           *env;
00181         struct cl_io            *io;
00182         struct vvp_io           *vio;
00183         struct cl_env_nest       nest;
00184         int                      result;
00185         sigset_t                 set;
00186         struct inode             *inode;
00187         struct ll_inode_info     *lli;
00188         ENTRY;
00189 
00190         LASSERT(vmpage != NULL);
00191 
00192         io = ll_fault_io_init(vma, &env,  &nest, vmpage->index, NULL);
00193         if (IS_ERR(io))
00194                 GOTO(out, result = PTR_ERR(io));
00195 
00196         result = io->ci_result;
00197         if (result < 0)
00198                 GOTO(out_io, result);
00199 
00200         io->u.ci_fault.ft_mkwrite = 1;
00201         io->u.ci_fault.ft_writable = 1;
00202 
00203         vio = vvp_env_io(env);
00204         vio->u.fault.ft_vma    = vma;
00205         vio->u.fault.ft_vmpage = vmpage;
00206 
00207         set = cfs_block_sigsinv(sigmask(SIGKILL) | sigmask(SIGTERM));
00208 
00209         inode = vvp_object_inode(io->ci_obj);
00210         lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00211 
00212         result = cl_io_loop(env, io);
00213 
00214         cfs_restore_sigs(set);
00215 
00216         if (result == 0) {
00217                 lock_page(vmpage);
00218                 if (vmpage->mapping == NULL) {
00219                         unlock_page(vmpage);
00220 
00221                         /* page was truncated and lock was cancelled, return
00222                          * ENODATA so that VM_FAULT_NOPAGE will be returned
00223                          * to handle_mm_fault(). */
00224                         if (result == 0)
00225                                 result = -ENODATA;
00226                 } else if (!PageDirty(vmpage)) {
00227                         /* race, the page has been cleaned by ptlrpcd after
00228                          * it was unlocked, it has to be added into dirty
00229                          * cache again otherwise this soon-to-dirty page won't
00230                          * consume any grants, even worse if this page is being
00231                          * transferred because it will break RPC checksum.
00232                          */
00233                         unlock_page(vmpage);
00234 
00235                         CDEBUG(D_MMAP, "Race on page_mkwrite %p/%lu, page has "
00236                                "been written out, retry.\n",
00237                                vmpage, vmpage->index);
00238 
00239                         *retry = true;
00240                         result = -EAGAIN;
00241                 }
00242 
00243                 if (result == 0)
00244                         ll_file_set_flag(lli, LLIF_DATA_MODIFIED);
00245         }
00246         EXIT;
00247 
00248 out_io:
00249         cl_io_fini(env, io);
00250         cl_env_nested_put(&nest, env);
00251 out:
00252         CDEBUG(D_MMAP, "%s mkwrite with %d\n", current->comm, result);
00253         LASSERT(ergo(result == 0, PageLocked(vmpage)));
00254 
00255         return result;
00256 }
00257 
00258 static inline int to_fault_error(int result)
00259 {
00260         switch(result) {
00261         case 0:
00262                 result = VM_FAULT_LOCKED;
00263                 break;
00264         case -EFAULT:
00265                 result = VM_FAULT_NOPAGE;
00266                 break;
00267         case -ENOMEM:
00268                 result = VM_FAULT_OOM;
00269                 break;
00270         default:
00271                 result = VM_FAULT_SIGBUS;
00272                 break;
00273         }
00274         return result;
00275 }
00276 
00288 static int ll_fault0(struct vm_area_struct *vma, struct vm_fault *vmf)
00289 {
00290         struct lu_env           *env;
00291         struct cl_io            *io;
00292         struct vvp_io           *vio = NULL;
00293         struct page             *vmpage;
00294         unsigned long            ra_flags;
00295         struct cl_env_nest       nest;
00296         int                      result;
00297         int                      fault_ret = 0;
00298         ENTRY;
00299 
00300         io = ll_fault_io_init(vma, &env,  &nest, vmf->pgoff, &ra_flags);
00301         if (IS_ERR(io))
00302                 RETURN(to_fault_error(PTR_ERR(io)));
00303 
00304         result = io->ci_result;
00305         if (result == 0) {
00306                 vio = vvp_env_io(env);
00307                 vio->u.fault.ft_vma       = vma;
00308                 vio->u.fault.ft_vmpage    = NULL;
00309                 vio->u.fault.ft_vmf = vmf;
00310                 vio->u.fault.ft_flags = 0;
00311                 vio->u.fault.ft_flags_valid = 0;
00312 
00313                 /* May call ll_readpage() */
00314                 ll_cl_add(vma->vm_file, env, io);
00315 
00316                 result = cl_io_loop(env, io);
00317 
00318                 ll_cl_remove(vma->vm_file, env);
00319 
00320                 /* ft_flags are only valid if we reached
00321                  * the call to filemap_fault */
00322                 if (vio->u.fault.ft_flags_valid)
00323                         fault_ret = vio->u.fault.ft_flags;
00324 
00325                 vmpage = vio->u.fault.ft_vmpage;
00326                 if (result != 0 && vmpage != NULL) {
00327                         page_cache_release(vmpage);
00328                         vmf->page = NULL;
00329                 }
00330         }
00331         cl_io_fini(env, io);
00332         cl_env_nested_put(&nest, env);
00333 
00334         vma->vm_flags |= ra_flags;
00335         if (result != 0 && !(fault_ret & VM_FAULT_RETRY))
00336                 fault_ret |= to_fault_error(result);
00337 
00338         CDEBUG(D_MMAP, "%s fault %d/%d\n",
00339                current->comm, fault_ret, result);
00340         RETURN(fault_ret);
00341 }
00342 
00343 static int ll_fault(struct vm_area_struct *vma, struct vm_fault *vmf)
00344 {
00345         int count = 0;
00346         bool printed = false;
00347         int result;
00348         sigset_t set;
00349 
00350         /* Only SIGKILL and SIGTERM is allowed for fault/nopage/mkwrite
00351          * so that it can be killed by admin but not cause segfault by
00352          * other signals. */
00353         set = cfs_block_sigsinv(sigmask(SIGKILL) | sigmask(SIGTERM));
00354 
00355 restart:
00356         result = ll_fault0(vma, vmf);
00357         LASSERT(!(result & VM_FAULT_LOCKED));
00358         if (result == 0) {
00359                 struct page *vmpage = vmf->page;
00360 
00361                 /* check if this page has been truncated */
00362                 lock_page(vmpage);
00363                 if (unlikely(vmpage->mapping == NULL)) { /* unlucky */
00364                         unlock_page(vmpage);
00365                         page_cache_release(vmpage);
00366                         vmf->page = NULL;
00367 
00368                         if (!printed && ++count > 16) {
00369                                 CWARN("the page is under heavy contention,"
00370                                       "maybe your app(%s) needs revising :-)\n",
00371                                       current->comm);
00372                                 printed = true;
00373                         }
00374 
00375                         goto restart;
00376                 }
00377 
00378                 result |= VM_FAULT_LOCKED;
00379         }
00380         cfs_restore_sigs(set);
00381         return result;
00382 }
00383 
00384 static int ll_page_mkwrite(struct vm_area_struct *vma, struct vm_fault *vmf)
00385 {
00386         int count = 0;
00387         bool printed = false;
00388         bool retry;
00389         int result;
00390 
00391         file_update_time(vma->vm_file);
00392         do {
00393                 retry = false;
00394                 result = ll_page_mkwrite0(vma, vmf->page, &retry);
00395 
00396                 if (!printed && ++count > 16) {
00397                         const struct dentry *de = vma->vm_file->f_path.dentry;
00398 
00399                         CWARN("app(%s): the page %lu of file "DFID" is under"
00400                               " heavy contention\n",
00401                               current->comm, vmf->pgoff,
00402                               PFID(ll_inode2fid(de->d_inode)));
00403                         printed = true;
00404                 }
00405         } while (retry);
00406 
00407         switch(result) {
00408         case 0:
00409                 LASSERT(PageLocked(vmf->page));
00410                 result = VM_FAULT_LOCKED;
00411                 break;
00412         case -ENODATA:
00413         case -EFAULT:
00414                 result = VM_FAULT_NOPAGE;
00415                 break;
00416         case -ENOMEM:
00417                 result = VM_FAULT_OOM;
00418                 break;
00419         case -EAGAIN:
00420                 result = VM_FAULT_RETRY;
00421                 break;
00422         default:
00423                 result = VM_FAULT_SIGBUS;
00424                 break;
00425         }
00426 
00427         return result;
00428 }
00429 
00434 static void ll_vm_open(struct vm_area_struct * vma)
00435 {
00436         struct inode *inode    = vma->vm_file->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
00437         struct vvp_object *vob = cl_inode2vvp(inode);
00438 
00439         ENTRY;
00440         LASSERT(vma->vm_file);
00441         LASSERT(atomic_read(&vob->vob_mmap_cnt) >= 0);
00442         atomic_inc(&vob->vob_mmap_cnt);
00443         EXIT;
00444 }
00445 
00449 static void ll_vm_close(struct vm_area_struct *vma)
00450 {
00451         struct inode      *inode = vma->vm_file->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
00452         struct vvp_object *vob   = cl_inode2vvp(inode);
00453 
00454         ENTRY;
00455         LASSERT(vma->vm_file);
00456         atomic_dec(&vob->vob_mmap_cnt);
00457         LASSERT(atomic_read(&vob->vob_mmap_cnt) >= 0);
00458         EXIT;
00459 }
00460 
00461 /* XXX put nice comment here.  talk about __free_pte -> dirty pages and
00462  * nopage's reference passing to the pte */
00463 int ll_teardown_mmaps(struct address_space *mapping, __u64 first, __u64 last)
00464 {
00465         int rc = -ENOENT;
00466         ENTRY;
00467 
00468         LASSERTF(last > first, "last "LPU64" first "LPU64"\n", last, first);
00469         if (mapping_mapped(mapping)) {
00470                 rc = 0;
00471                 unmap_mapping_range(mapping, first + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1,
00472                                     last - first + 1, 0);
00473         }
00474 
00475         RETURN(rc);
00476 }
00477 
00478 static const struct vm_operations_struct ll_file_vm_ops = {
00479         .fault                  = ll_fault,
00480         .page_mkwrite           = ll_page_mkwrite,
00481         .open                   = ll_vm_open,
00482         .close                  = ll_vm_close,
00483 };
00484 
00485 int ll_file_mmap(struct file *file, struct vm_area_struct * vma)
00486 {
00487         struct inode *inode = file->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
00488         int rc;
00489         ENTRY;
00490 
00491         if (ll_file_nolock(file))
00492                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00493 
00494         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(inode), LPROC_LL_MAP, 1);
00495         rc = generic_file_mmap(file, vma);
00496         if (rc == 0) {
00497                 vma->vm_ops = &ll_file_vm_ops;
00498                 vma->vm_ops->open(vma);
00499                 /* update the inode's size and mtime */
00500                 rc = ll_glimpse_size(inode);
00501         }
00502 
00503         RETURN(rc);
00504 }
